DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of teeth, the hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates, enrolled on the controlled study performed in human subjects and intended to discover, and/or evaluate, and/or verify safety, effectiveness, clinical and pharmacological effects, and adverse reactions of new drugs, devices, treatments, preventive measures, or other medical interventions in treating, preventing, or diagnosing a specific disease or condition.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the enrollment or registration of the hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates on the controlled study performed in human subjects and intended to discover, and/or evaluate, and/or verify safety, effectiveness, clinical and pharmacological effects, and adverse reactions of new drugs, devices, treatments, preventive measures, or other medical interventions in treating, preventing, or diagnosing a specific disease or condition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.:Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of teeth being enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many teeth are being enrolled on this protocol

DataElement.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
